meanings.definition: Sharpen or refine (a skill or ability)
meanings.sent1: She spends hours honing her painting skills every day.
meanings.sent2: He is honing his soccer techniques to become a better player.
meanings.sent3: The chef was honing his chopping skills so much that he accidentally cut his finger!
meanings.sent4: Like a sculptor honing a block of marble, she meticulously shapes her writing.
meanings.sent5: With each stroke of the brush, she was honing her artistic talent to perfection.

meanings.definition: To make more effective or efficient
meanings.sent1: The new software update is honing the system's performance significantly.
meanings.sent2: Regular practice is key to honing your public speaking skills.
meanings.sent3: The team was honing their strategy like expert craftsmen, aiming for victory.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was honing the project into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The coach's guidance is honing the team into a formidable force on the field.

meanings.definition: To focus or concentrate on improving something
meanings.sent1: She is honing in on her weaknesses to become a better student.
meanings.sent2: The company is honing its marketing campaign to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The detective was honing his investigative skills to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His determination was honing his resolve to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: By honing her time management, she was able to achieve great success in her projects.
